subject: Dutch Treats and Casting Calls
event:
Yes, three more roles have been cast for the GAME OF THRONES pilot, as David Benioff and Dan Weiss announced over on Westeros.

No, I can't tell you who they are.  HBO will make the announcements in due time, I'm sure.  When?  I don't know.  Tomorrow, next week, next month.  They don't consult with me.  As I write this, I am aware of five parts that have been cast but not yet announced, but there could well be more.  Things are moving quickly now.  And of course, casting a role is not just a matter of picking an actor.  Even after you decide who you want, there are offers and counter-offers, contract negotiations, a whole delicate dance that goes on.  It is never wise to leak things prematurely.  Sometimes that can actually throw a monkey wrench into the process.

I'm excited about the choices, though.

What can I say?  Not much.  

Maybe a few hints...

The five roles... well, we have cast Jaime Lannister and Theon Greyjoy, I let that slip in Montreal... the three new ones are all females.  A couple small roles, but very important ones.  One player has something in common with Ned.  One has something in common with Harry Potter.  One is not a boney pop singer.  Shows can get cancelled and so can characters, but two of them have been seen on American tv recently.

And that's all you're getting from me, until HBO blows the trumpet.

comments.article: OMG I AM SO EXCITED TO FIND OUT!!! And a riddle too...brb trying to figure it out!

comments.upictitle: an owl on the sill in the evening: owl
comments.article: LOL, I've been trying to figure it out too, I think besides Lyanna being one of the females I have no guess at all.

OH DEAR LORD

[=snort=]

*dies at the teasing*

But yes, MOAR FEMALE ROLES. ♥

I absolutely cannot wait to find out who is cast as Jaime.

Actually, I absolutely cannot wait for the entire project!!!!

"Has something in common with Ned."  I'm assuming GRRM means the actor potraying Ned, Sean Bean.   Sean Bean was in a tele-movie with a bloke called Toby Stephens (Gustave Graves in Die Another Day 007 flick), whom I always though would make a brilliant Jaime.  Smart-arsed, witty, charismatic and odiously arrogant all in one.  Just needs a good gold hair dye.

comments.upictitle: numerous legit lady boners: fangirl leen with mclovin
comments.article:
*flail*

That is all.

Now you've got us all excited. At least I'm slowly addicting my family and friends so now they're looking forward to the series too. Hopefully you can spill on the details soon.

And hopefully I can get the older students at school into the series this fall, too, when I start as the new librarian. Don't think I'll be reading it to the kindergartners at storytime, though.

My guesses are:

Lyanna

Nan

Don't really know what other small female roles there could be, given the time window in the pilot. Maybe Dany's mom, the Mad King's wife?
comments.subject: Some of my guesses...

comments.article:
I am excited to hear more news!! =D

You are such a tease Mr. Martin!!

Here's my guess - 'boney pop singer' refers to the pop group Boney M, one of whose singers was Elizabeth Mitchell, who is the not the same Eilzabeth Mitchell as the American actress who plays Juliette on Lost.

Oh, VERY good. Wrong, alas, but oh, so close.

FWIW, the only Elizabeth Mitchell I know is the editor at Del Rey Books. Terrific editor who I have known since she was just an assistant on ANALOG. She was my editor at Baen on TUF VOYAGING, and my editor at Bantam on WILD CARDS vols. 5 through 12.

But she's not been cast in the pilot, no.

Shows can get cancelled and so can characters, but two of them have been seen on American tv recently.

If the female roles are small, that seems to rule out Sansa, Arya or Cersei. So ummmmm Septa Whatsername, Old Nan and the Maegi Dany saves, then kills?
